item.title: Report E-2025050421
item.description:
Report E-2025050421

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-19
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO contacted ERTS regarding a puncture leaking 05PAIL containing hazardous product, Step Down. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 5-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 7' x 6' area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 7' x 6' area as a result of a forklift puncture. The contractor neutralized the release using citric acid and applied oil dry. One 55-gallon DF of waste was generated containing the damaged pail and the impacted absorbents and PPE. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025050380
item.description:
Report E-2025050380

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-13
  • City: NEWTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR RANGER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13, 2025, at 0952 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Ranger personnel in Newton, NC regarding the release of ShrinkPET HSPRO YELLOW. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1-gallon of ShrinkPET HSPRO YELLOW (UN1210, 3, II) from (8) 1-gallon steel pails onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to a load shift, impacting a 3’ x 4’ area of the trailer floor and damaging a 55-gallon DM of product. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned with absorbent pads and the proper PPE. The 55-gallon damaged DM of product was placed into an 85-gallon DM overpack and all other waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (2) 55-gallon DMs. All waste was taken off-site by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025050964
item.description:
Report X-2025050964

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-12
  • City: NEW BERN
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 12th at approximately 11::00 AM, FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration was notified by station management of a leaking package at New Bern, NC station, tracking number 447020814580. Upon investigation, the package contained a leaking battery, Deka Master Marine Deep Cycle. The package did not have any dangerous goods marking/labeling. FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration searched for the safety data sheet for the battery. Based upon the information provided, this appears to be classified as UN2794 Batteries, Wet, Filled With Acid. The spill was contained in a salvage drum by management and then advised by FedEx Dangerous Goods Administration to hold the package pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2025050500
item.description:
Report E-2025050500

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-06
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1425 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BGB. It was reported that an estimated 12) 2.5-gallon cardboard boxes w/ plastic bladder bags of UN1791 "Marketguard 121" released due to shipper error. The release impacted trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 gallons UN1791 Marketguard 121 released to the trailer floor impacting 5’x5’ area due to load shift. The contractors cleaned the release with oil dri and generated (10) drums of waste (9) consisting of cardboard and damaged product and the 10th drum containing PPE. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report X-2025050589

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-01
  • City: SHELBY
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED DURING THE UNLOAD PHASE. THE PACKAGE WAS LABELED WITH CORROSIVE LIQUID HAZARD LABELS WITH APPROPRIATE SHIPPING PAPER AND SDS. WEARING PPES, RESPONDER CARRIED THE BOX TO THE DMP AREA. AFTER REFERENCING THE DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET, CLEANED UP THE SPILL ACCORDING TO THE LISTED PROCEDURES. RESPONDER DECONTAMINATED THE PPES AND EQUIPMENT.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Loaded car TELX 49036 was delivered to customer facility, Stockhausen Superabsorber, LCC with active leak from lquid line valve. Delivery occurred at night and spillage was only one side of car therefore conductor did not detect presence of the leak. Customer facility personnel found leak after crew departed area and reported it Norfolk Southern. Customer reported the plug on the liquid valve was tool tight but was corroded and had an insufficient amount of thread tape. Liquid was observed between the ball valve and the plug. Customer report an excessive amount of pressure on the car but could not provide a pressure reading.

item.title: Report E-2025050155
item.description:
Report E-2025050155

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-11
  • City: KERNERSVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1545 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NWN. It was reported that approximately .25 of Calibre WW Delimer was released from (1) 1-gallon bladder box due to improper loading by the shipper. The release impacted the trailer floor and another box. The caller stated the spill was cleaned up and containerized prior to calling it in using oil dri on site. the damaged boxes were placed into (1) 35-gallon DF. 232852-1 – 35-gallon DF contains (2) 1-gallon bladder boxes
